kassenSystem.model

Class ProductList

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • kassenSystem.model.ProductList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel

    public class ProductList
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
    This is the list of Products currently in stock.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • addProduct

        public void addProduct(java.lang.String name,
                       long id,
                       int stock,
                       double weight,
                       java.lang.String weightUnit,
                       double price,
                       java.lang.String category)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a new product to the productList. The parameters name, id, stock, weight and Price are entered by the user. The weightUnit and category are selected from a dropdown menu. The category will be supplied by the category list and will not be entered separately. Throws Exception if the product id is already used by a product in the list.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new product
        id - the identification number of the new product
        stock - the amount of units of the new product
        weight - the weight of the product
        weightUnit - the unit of the given weight e.g. g,kg,ml,l,st端ck
        price - the price of the product
        category - the category the product will be assigned to
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the product id is already used by a product in the list

      • addProduct

        public void addProduct(java.lang.String name,
                       long id,
                       java.lang.String specialStock,
                       double weight,
                       java.lang.String weightUnit,
                       double basePrice,
                       java.lang.String category)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a new product to the productList. The parameters name, id, specialStock, weight and basePrice are entered by the user. The weightUnit and category are selected from a dropdown menu. The category will be supplied by the category list and will not be entered separately. Throws Exception if the product id is already used by a product in the list.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new product
        id - the identification number of the new product
        specialStock - The special case where a product can not be counted, has to be either n or N
        weight - the weight of the product
        weightUnit - the unit of the given weight e.g. g,kg,ml,l,st端ck
        basePrice - the base price of the product
        category - the category the product will be assigned to
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the product id is already used by a product in the list

      • removeProduct

        public void removeProduct(Product product)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes the specified product from the productList. Throws Exception if the remove function is not used correctly or a wrong type of element that is being removed is supplied.
        Parameters:
        product - the product that shall be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the remove function is not used correctly or a wrong type of element that is being removed is supplied

      • searchProductByName

        public java.util.ArrayList<Product> searchProductByName(java.lang.String searchPhrase)
        Searches the productList for a product with this name. The entered search phrase can be a substring of the results or a specific name.
        Parameters:
        searchPhrase - the search phrase that is looked for in the productList
        Returns:
        a list of products with the same name as the search phrase, or where the given search phrase is part of the name

      • searchProductById

        public java.util.ArrayList<Product> searchProductById(java.lang.Long id)
        Searches the productList for a product with this id. The entered search phrase can be a partial id of the results or a specific id.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of a product
        Returns:
        a list of products with the same id as the search phrase, or where the given search phrase is part of the id

      • searchProduct

        public java.util.ArrayList<Product> searchProduct(java.lang.String searchPhrase)
        Searches the productList for a product with this name or id. The search phrase can be a specific name or id of the results or it can be part of them.
        Parameters:
        searchPhrase - the search phrase that is looked for in the productList
        Returns:
        a list of product with the same name or id regarding what was searched for, or where the search phrase is part of the name or id

      • changeProduct

        public void changeProduct(int index,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          long id,
                          int stock,
                          double weight,
                          java.lang.String weightUnit,
                          double price,
                          java.lang.String category)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the parameters of a product in the database. Throws Exception if a parameter violates the restrictions set in the addProduct function.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the product that shall be changed
        name - the name of the new product
        id - the identification number of the new product
        stock - the amount of units of the new product
        weight - the weight of the new product
        weightUnit - the unit of the given weight e.g. g,kg,ml,l,st端ck
        price - the price of the new product
        category - the category the new product will be assigned to
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a parameter violates the restrictions set in the addProduct function

      • changeProduct

        public void changeProduct(int index,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          long id,
                          java.lang.String specialStock,
                          double weight,
                          java.lang.String weightUnit,
                          double basePrice,
                          java.lang.String category)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Changes the parameters of a product in the database. Throws Exception if a parameter violates the restrictions set in the addProduct function.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the product that shall be changed
        name - the name of the new product
        id - the identification number of the new product
        specialStock - The special case where a product can not be counted, has to be either n or N
        weight - the weight of the new product
        weightUnit - the unit of the given weight e.g. g,kg,ml,l,st端ck
        basePrice - the base price of the new product
        category - the category the new product will be assigned to
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a parameter violates the restrictions set in the addProduct function

      • saveToProductDatabase

        public void saveToProductDatabase()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Saves all products to the ProductDatabase. The save function will be executed only once when the application is closed, because the way the product list is implemented represents an inMemory database. Throws IOException if the the file the writer accesses is non existent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the the file the writer accesses is non existent

      • loadFromProductDatabase

        public void loadFromProductDatabase()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Loads all Products from the ProductDatabase. The load function will be executed only once when the application is started, because the way the product list is implemented represents an inMemory database. Throws IO Exception if there is no file or a wrong path declared to read from.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the the file the reader accesses is non existent

      • getProductList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Product> getProductList()
        Returns the productList.
        Returns:
        the productList

      • getRowCount

        public int getRowCount()
        Returns the number of rows in the model. A JTable uses this method to determine how many rows it should display. This method should be quick, as it is called frequently during rendering.
        Returns:
        the number of rows in the model
        See Also:
        getColumnCount()

      • getColumnCount

        public int getColumnCount()
        Returns the number of columns in the model. A JTable uses this method to determine how many columns it should create and display by default.
        Returns:
        the number of columns in the model
        See Also:
        getRowCount()
